test_cases.Title: Successful User Login with Valid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Open the Zenit application on the mobile device.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches and displays the login screen.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid username and password into the respective fields.
Steps.Expected Result: The username and password fields accept the input.
The system authenticates the credentials and navigates the user to the home/dashboard screen.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has a registered account with valid credentials. The mobile device is connected to the internet.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid username and password (e.g., user1@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the home/dashboard screen.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Invalid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Open the Zenit application on the mobile device.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches and displays the login screen.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid username and/or password into the respective fields.
Steps.Expected Result: The username and password fields accept the input.
The system displays an error message indicating invalid credentials and remains on the login screen.

test_cases.Preconditions: User does not have valid credentials. The mobile device is connected to the internet.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid username and/or password (e.g., user1@example.com / WrongPass)
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not logged in. An error message is displayed, and the login screen remains visible.

test_cases.Title: Password Recovery Flow - Valid Email

Steps.Step Description: Open the Zenit application and navigate to the login screen.

Steps.Expected Result: The password recovery screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a registered email address and submit the request.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation message is displayed indicating that a password reset email has been sent.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has a registered account with a valid email address. The device is connected to the internet.
test_cases.Expected Result: A password reset email is sent to the provided address, and the user is informed accordingly.

test_cases.Title: Password Recovery Flow - Unregistered Email

Steps.Step Description: Open the Zenit application and navigate to the login screen.

Steps.Expected Result: The password recovery screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an unregistered email address and submit the request.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed indicating that the email address is not recognized.

test_cases.Preconditions: User does not have an account with the provided email address. The device is connected to the internet.
test_cases.Expected Result: No password reset email is sent. The user is informed that the email address is not recognized.

test_cases.Title: Session Timeout After Inactivity

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Zenit application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and navigated to the home/dashboard screen.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive (do not interact with the app) for the configured session timeout period (e.g., 15 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: The session remains active until the timeout period elapses.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application after the timeout period.
Steps.Expected Result: The user is automatically logged out and redirected to the login screen with a session timeout message.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged in. The session timeout is configured (e.g., 15 minutes).
test_cases.Expected Result: User is logged out after inactivity and redirected to the login screen with an appropriate message.

test_cases.Title: Login Attempt with Empty Fields

Steps.Step Description: Open the Zenit application on the mobile device.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches and displays the login screen.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the username and password fields empty.

Steps.Expected Result: The system displays an error message indicating that both fields are required.

test_cases.Preconditions: None. The application is installed and accessible.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is not logged in. An error message is displayed indicating that both fields are required.
